field.name: Administer 1st dose of rotavirus vaccine ideally when child is 6 weeks old or latest by 15 weeks; and 2nd dose ideally by 10 weeks or latest by 24 weeks
Rotavirus vaccine should not be given if child has a history of abdominal surgery, history of uncorrected congenital malformation of the gastrointestinal tract & a history of intussusceptions
Infants should not be vaccinated if a previous vaccination was followed by anaphylaxis, encephalitis or non-febrile convulsions
Yellow fever vaccine should not be given if there is history of anaphylaxis with ingestion of egg
BCG vaccine can be administered at birth since the HIV infected newborns are asymptomatic
Children with symptomatic HIV infection should not receive BCG, Yellow Fever & Pneumococcal vaccines
Although the Measles vaccine is a live attenuated vaccine, it should be given to HIV infected children as the benefits outweighs the risks
